A good rattle of the telephone cable in the trunking at the socket also reveals very little.  Does anybody know where / how the phone lines are connected / enter the property? summary.body: Can anyone advise about a strange call I had today? Someone asking for my husband and claiming to be from BT rang to ask if we had any problems with our phone line, because they are going to dig up the road tomorrow to fix it and were just covering our arses. I know he wasnt from BT (as Im the subscriber, not my husband). But Im at a loss to understand why someone would ask for my husband by name, supposedly to enquire about our phone service. Any ideas? (BT werent that helpful. Apparently when the caller display reads Unavailable it always means the call is from overseas  I didnt realise that. (It was, however, an English voice.) BT claim that people are always ringing up claiming to represent them, & are clearly not interested in doing anything about it.)
summary.subject: strange phone calls
